titleproper.value: Guide to the William Bryans Papers <num>MC.29</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-09-30T14:53:10</date>

abstract.value: This collection documents the history of the College of Engineering as written by a New York University (NYU) faculty member. Bryans served both as Assistant Dean and Professor of Engineering Mechanics at the College of Engineering in his four-decade career at the University. The collection contains manuscripts of and photographs from two separate histories of the College written by Bryans.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); The William Bryans Papers; MC 29; box number; folder number; New York University Archives

Bryans was a member of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers, the Society for the Promotion of Engineering Education, the American Association for the Advancement of Science, the American Association of University Professors, Iota Alpha, and the NYU Faculty Club. During World War I, Bryans served as Assistant Director in charge of instruction for the Student Army Training Corps from 1917-1918.

This collection documents the historical research of an NYU alumnus who went on to serve the University as both a professor and an administrator. The collection contains manuscripts for two works on the history of the College of Engineering as well as photographs that illustrate each manuscript.

corpname.value: New York University. College of Engineering
